Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Male C57BL / 6 mice were administered with subconvulsive dose of pentylenetetrazole ( 37 mg / kg , i . p . ) every other day for 14 injections .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| subconvulsive dose of pentylenetetrazole |

The term "subconvulsive dose of pentylenetetrazole" can be considered a disease entity in this context because it refers to a treatment that is being administered to the mice. Pentylenetetrazole is a chemical compound that is used in medical research to induce seizures and study epilepsy and related disorders. In this case, the dose is described as "subconvulsive," which means it is low enough to not cause seizures but can still have other effects on the nervous system. Therefore, it is appropriate to consider this a disease entity.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| subconvulsive dose of pentylenetetrazole |

In the original paragraph, there is only one term that can be considered a disease entity, which is "subconvulsive dose of pentylenetetrazole." The other terms in the paragraph refer to the experimental procedure and the species of mice used in the study, which do not refer to diseases. Therefore, the table above lists the single disease entity found in the paragraph.

3. i. p.: It stands for "intraperitoneal," a route of administration for the chemical compound.
